00017 package WeBWorK::Authen::Moodle;
00018 use base qw/WeBWorK::Authen/;
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::Authen::Moodle - Allow moodle cookies to be used for WeBWorK authentication.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 =for comment
00027 
00028 TODO
00029 
00030 * Modules that modify data that's being taken from moodle should check for "alternative URLs" in the
00031 CE that can point back to the moodle installation. operations include: change password, change user
00032 data, change permission level, add user, delete user. Run this for a rough estimate:
00033     pcregrep -r '\$db->(add|put)(User|Password|PermissionLevel)\b' lib
00034 
00035 =cut

00037 use strict;
00038 use warnings;
00039 use Digest::MD5 qw/md5_hex/;
00040 use WeBWorK::Cookie;
00041 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00042 use Date::Parse; # for moodle 1.7 date parsing
00043 
00044 use mod_perl;
00045 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );
00046 
00047 sub new {
00048     my $self = shift->SUPER::new(@_);
00049     
00050     $self->init_mdl_session;
00051     
00052     return $self;
00053 }
00054 
00055 # call superclass get_credentials. if no credentials were found, look for a moodle cooke.
00056 # if a moodle cookie is found, a new webwork session is created and the session key is used.
00057 # (this is similar to what happens when a guest user is selected.)
00058 sub get_credentials {
00059     my $self = shift;
00060     my $r = $self->{r};
00061     
00062     my $super_result = $self->SUPER::get_credentials;
00063     if ($super_result) {
00064         debug("Superclass's get_credentials found credentials. Using them.\n");
00065         return $super_result;
00066     }
00067     
00068     my ($moodle_user_id, $moodle_expiration_time) = $self->fetch_moodle_session;
00069     #debug("fetch_moodle_session returned: moodle_user_id='$moodle_user_id' moodle_expiration_time='$moodle_expiration_time'.\n"); # causes errors when undefined
00070     
00071     if (defined $moodle_user_id and defined $moodle_expiration_time and time <= $moodle_expiration_time) {
00072         my $newKey = $self->create_session($moodle_user_id);
00073         debug("Unexpired moodle session found. Created new WeBWorK session with newKey='$newKey'.\n");
00074         
00075         $self->{user_id} = $moodle_user_id;
00076         $self->{session_key} = $newKey;
00077         $self->{login_type} = "normal";
00078         $self->{credential_source} = "moodle";
00079         return 1;
00080     } else {
00081         debug("No moodle session found or moodle session expired. No credentials to be had.\n");
00082         warn("No moodle session found or moodle sessioin expired.  If this happens repeatedly and you are constantly being asked
00083               to log back in ask your moodle admin to check that the Moodle item: 
00084               Server -> Session Handling -> dbsessions (Use database for session information) has been checked.");
00085     }
00086     
00087     return 0;
00088 }
00089 
00090 # extend the moodle session if authentication succeeded
00091 sub site_fixup {
00092     my $self = shift;
00093     
00094     if ($self->was_verified) {
00095         debug("User was verified, updating moodle session.\n");
00096         $self->update_moodle_session;
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 # we assume that the database is set up to use the moodle password table, which uses MD5 passwords.
00101 # this is overridden to accommodate this.
00102 sub checkPassword {
00103     my ($self, $userID, $possibleClearPassword) = @_;
00104     my $db = $self->{r}->db;
00105     
00106     debug("Moodle module is doing the password checking.\n");
00107     
00108     my $Password = $db->getPassword($userID); # checked
00109     if (defined $Password) {
00110         # check against Moodle password database
00111         my $possibleMD5Password = md5_hex($possibleClearPassword);
00112         debug("Hashed password from supplied cleartext: '$possibleMD5Password'.\n");
00113         debug("Hashed password from Password record: '", $Password->password, "'.\n");
00114         if ($possibleMD5Password eq $Password->password) {
00115             $self->write_log_entry("AUTH MDL: password accepted");
00116             return 1;
00117         } else {
00118             if ($self->can("site_checkPassword")) {
00119                 $self->write_log_entry("AUTH MDL: password rejected, deferring to site_checkPassword");
00120                 return $self->site_checkPassword($userID, $possibleClearPassword);
00121             } else {
00122                 $self->write_log_entry("AUTH MDL: password rejected");
00123                 return 0;
00124             }
00125         }
00126         
00127     }
00128 }
00129 
00130 sub check_session {
00131     my ($self, $user_id, $session_key, $update_timestamp) = @_;
00132     
00133     my ($sessionExists, $keyMatches, $timestampValid) = $self->SUPER::check_session($user_id, $session_key, $update_timestamp);
00134     debug("SUPER::check_session returned: sessionExists='", $sessionExists, "' keyMatches='", $keyMatches, "' timestampValid='", $timestampValid, "'");
00135     
00136     if ($update_timestamp and $sessionExists and $keyMatches and not $timestampValid) {
00137         debug("special case: webwork key matches an expired session (check for a unexpired moodle session)");
00138         my ($moodle_user_id, $moodle_expiration_time) = $self->fetch_moodle_session;
00139         debug("fetch_moodle_session returned: moodle_user_id='$moodle_user_id' moodle_expiration_time='$moodle_expiration_time'.\n");
00140         if (defined $moodle_user_id and $moodle_user_id eq $user_id
00141                 and defined $moodle_expiration_time and time <= $moodle_expiration_time) {
00142             $self->{session_key} = $self->create_session($moodle_user_id);
00143             $timestampValid = 1;
00144         }
00145     }
00146     
00147     return $sessionExists, $keyMatches, $timestampValid;
00148 }

00152 use DBI;
00153 use PHP::Serialization qw/unserialize/;
00154 
00155 use constant DEFAULT_EXPIRY => 7200;
00156 
00157 sub init_mdl_session {
00158     my $self = shift;
00159     
00160     # version-specific stuff
00161     $self->{moodle17} = $self->{r}->ce->{authen}{moodle_options}{moodle17};
00162     $self->{sql_session_table} = $self->{moodle17} ? "sessions2" : "sessions";
00163     $self->{sql_data_field} = $self->{moodle17} ? "sessdata" : "data";
00164     
00165     $self->{mdl_dbh} = DBI->connect_cached(
00166         $self->{r}->ce->{authen}{moodle_options}{dsn},
00167         $self->{r}->ce->{authen}{moodle_options}{username},
00168         $self->{r}->ce->{authen}{moodle_options}{password},
00169         {
00170             PrintError => 0,
00171             RaiseError => 1,
00172         },
00173     );
00174     die $DBI::errstr unless defined $self->{mdl_dbh};
00175 }
00176 
00177 sub fetch_moodle_session {
00178     # fetches the basic information from the moodle session.
00179     # returns the user name and expiration time of the moodle session
00180     # Note that we don't worry about the user being in this course at this point.
00181     # That is taken care of in Schema::Moodle::User.
00182     my ($self) = @_;
00183     my $r = $self->{r};
00184     my $db = $r->db;
00185     
00186     my %cookies = WeBWorK::Cookie->fetch( MP2 ? $r : () );
00187     my $cookie = $cookies{"MoodleSession"};
00188     return unless $cookie;
00189     
00190     my $session_table = $self->prefix_table($self->{sql_session_table});
00191     my $data_field = $self->{sql_data_field};
00192     my $stmt = "SELECT `expiry`,`$data_field` FROM `$session_table` WHERE `sesskey`=?";
00193     my @bind_vals = $cookie->value;
00194     
00195     my $sth = $self->{mdl_dbh}->prepare_cached($stmt, undef, 3); # 3: see DBI docs
00196     $sth->execute(@bind_vals);
00197     my $row = $sth->fetchrow_arrayref;
00198     $sth->finish;
00199     return unless defined $row;
00200     
00201     my ($expires, $data_string) = @$row;
00202     
00203     # Moodle 1.7 stores expiry as a DATETIME, but WeBWorK wants a UNIX timestamp.
00204     $expires = str2time($expires) if $self->{moodle17};
00205     
00206     my $data = unserialize_session($data_string);
00207     my $username = $data->{"USER"}{"username"};
00208     
00209     return $username, $expires;
00210 }
00211 
00212 sub update_moodle_session {
00213     # extend the timeout of the current moodle session, if one exists.
00214     my ($self) = @_;
00215     my $r = $self->{r};
00216     my $db = $r->db;
00217     
00218     my %cookies = WeBWorK::Cookie->fetch( MP2 ? $r : () );
00219     my $cookie = $cookies{"MoodleSession"};
00220     return unless $cookie;
00221     
00222     my $config_table = $self->prefix_table("config");
00223     my $value = "IFNULL((SELECT `value` FROM `$config_table` WHERE `name`=?),?)+?";
00224     
00225     # Moodle 1.7 stores expiry as a DATETIME, but WeBWorK supplies a UNIX timestamp.
00226     $value = "FROM_UNIXTIME($value)" if $self->{moodle17};
00227     
00228     my $session_table = $self->prefix_table($self->{sql_session_table});
00229     my $stmt = "UPDATE `$session_table` SET `expiry`=$value WHERE `sesskey`=?";
00230     my @bind_vals = ("sessiontimeout", DEFAULT_EXPIRY, time, $cookie->value);
00231     
00232     my $sth = $self->{mdl_dbh}->prepare_cached($stmt, undef, 3); # 3: see DBI docs
00233     my $result = $sth->execute(@bind_vals);
00234     $sth->finish;
00235     
00236     return defined $result;
00237 }
00238 
00239 sub prefix_table {
00240     my ($self, $base) = @_;
00241     if (defined $self->{r}->ce->{authen}{moodle_options}{table_prefix}) {
00242         return $self->{r}->ce->{authen}{moodle_options}{table_prefix} . $base;
00243     } else {
00244         return $base;
00245     }
00246 }
00247 
00248 sub unserialize_session {
00249     my $serialData = shift;
00250     # first, url decode:
00251     $serialData =~ s/\%([A-Fa-f0-9]{2})/pack('C', hex($1))/seg;
00252     # then, split it up by |, it's some ADODB sillyness
00253     my @serialArray = split(/(\w+)\|/, $serialData);
00254     my %variables;
00255     # finally, actually deserialize it:
00256     for( my $i = 1; $i < $#serialArray; $i += 2 ) {
00257         $variables{$serialArray[$i]} = unserialize($serialArray[$i+1]);
00258     }
00259     return \%variables;
00260 }
